intro: Ptilotus halophilus, commonly known as the saltbush, is a flowering plant native to arid and saline environments in Australia. It belongs to the genus Ptilotus within the family Amaranthaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is adapted to thrive in salty soils, making it a valuable species for rehabilitation of degraded lands. Its ability to tolerate high salinity and drought makes it an important component of coastal and inland ecosystems. Ptilotus halophilus is also known for its use in traditional Aboriginal practices and as a potential source of edible seeds.
